description: Manage the workload profiles of a Container Apps environment.

commands.name: az containerapp env workload-profile add
commands.summary: Create a workload profile in a Container Apps environment.
examples: az containerapp env workload-profile add -g MyResourceGroup -n MyEnvironment --workload-profile-name my-wlp --workload-profile-type D4 --min-nodes 1 --max-nodes 2

commands.name: az containerapp env workload-profile delete
commands.summary: Delete a workload profile from a Container Apps environment.
examples: az containerapp env workload-profile delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyEnvironment --workload-profile-name my-wlp

commands.name: az containerapp env workload-profile list
commands.summary: List the workload profiles from a Container Apps environment.
examples: az containerapp env workload-profile list -g MyResourceGroup -n MyEnvironment

commands.name: az containerapp env workload-profile list-supported
commands.summary: List the supported workload profiles in a region.
examples: az containerapp env workload-profile list-supported -l region

commands.name: az containerapp env workload-profile show
commands.summary: Show a workload profile from a Container Apps environment.
examples: az containerapp env workload-profile show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyEnvironment --workload-profile-name my-wlp

commands.name: az containerapp env workload-profile update
commands.summary: Update an existing workload profile in a Container Apps environment.
examples: az containerapp env workload-profile update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyEnvironment --workload-profile-name my-wlp --min-nodes 1 --max-nodes 3
